channel.title: Nord Stage 2 midi not working
channel.description: Nord Stage 2 USB MIDI does not seem to work. :rage: Axoloti says: USB Device Attached Axoloti says: PID: 21h Axoloti says: VID: FFCh Axoloti says: Address (#1) assigned. Axoloti says: Manufacturer : Clavia DMI AB Axoloti says: Product : Nord Stage 2 Axoloti says: Serial Number : N/A Axoloti says: Enumeration done. Axoloti says: This device has only 1 configuration. Axoloti says: Default configuration set. Axoloti says: Device not supporting VEN class.

item.description:

I pulled the latest git commit and compiled fine. Nord Stage 2 USB MIDI works again!
Many thank for resolving this issue.

item.title: Nord Stage 2 midi not working
item.dc:creator: @gabriel
item.description:
@gabriel wrote:

@johannes, you are correct, I had the audio connected to the 3.5mm output... I thought they were the same.
No high pitch in the line output. Sorry for the false alarm.

And yes the act of disconnecting the Nord USB (from either the Axoloti side or the Nord side) reduced the pitch volume noticeably.

Read full topic

item.title: Nord Stage 2 midi not working
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

gabriel:

There is however a very high pitch (3KHz according to SpectrumLab) leaking into the audio signal. I suspect that it might be related to the k-rate clock?
The signal goes away as soon as I disconnect the USB controller.

As soon as you disconnect the Nord Stage you mean?
Can you confirm that your soundcard is connected to the line output (not headphone output) of Axoloti?

Read full topic

item.title: Nord Stage 2 midi not working
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

sorry no idea on the mouse controlled keyboard issue - some java version issue Id expect, given its working on 64 bit and also other platforms.

high pitch signal... usb code for midi has nothing that would do this. so sounds like electrical interference, grounding perhaps? I advise caution here - grounding issues can make things go pop! @johannes thoughts?

USB MIDI , ok better news on this, Ive just submitted a Pull Request that should resolve this.

basically, Ive changed the STM host code to try other USB handler classes if NOT_SUPPORTED is returned.
Ive change the class that handles vendor specific drivers to return this, unless it handles the device.
(Ive also raised the midi audio streaming handler back to the top, so its higher priority)

once the pull request is merged, you can try the Nord again.

Read full topic

item.title: Nord Stage 2 midi not working
item.dc:creator: @gabriel
item.description:
@gabriel wrote:

Hi @thethechnobear, you were right, it works in 1.0.6 both the Nord Stage 2 and the mouse-controlled Keyboard window.

There is however a very high pitch (3KHz according to SpectrumLab) leaking into the audio signal. I suspect that it might be related to the k-rate clock?
The signal goes away as soon as I disconnect the USB controller. If I switch toggle the Live mode off it godes down, but not completely.

I can also confirm also that under 1.0.8 the Keyboard window is functional in the 64bit linux I am trying (Ubuntu Studio 14.04), but the USB is still not so.

Read full topic

item.title: Nord Stage 2 midi not working
item.dc:creator: @gabriel
item.description:
@gabriel wrote:

Thanks. I will try 1.0.6 and sorry I did not notice the request to put in a different thread.
I am on a 32 bit linux system and the deb files are 64bit, so I need to compile from source.
I managed to compile 1.0.8 fine, but 1.0.6 gives me an error in build-impl.xml line 261 that I do not know how to resolve.
So I will have to find a 64bit machine and load a compiled version of the software to test. Will report back.

Read full topic

item.title: Nord Stage 2 midi not working
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

please ... the USB midi controller thread, clearly states to not post issues in it, but to post as a separate topic...
everyone putting issues about controllers in that thread, would make it unwieldy.

also please do not post the same issue in multiple threads... it will not make us look into it any quicker!

ok, I notice now I both topics its a Stage 2.

as stated please test in 1.0.6, it should work there.

when I get time, I'll look into fixing 1.0.8

Read full topic

item.title: Nord Stage 2 midi not working
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

can you try 1.0.6 with the nord. (there is a git tag for 1.0.6) ... a G2?

also someone else with a G2 keyboard on mac/windows, do you get the same on 1.0.8?

I suspect this will will work,
the above is due to a vendor interface being found, but that we don't support, rather than picking up the midi definition.
I need to check to see if I can switch the priority, though the 'core' problem is deeper, its that we are not skipping interfaces we don't support, and also not supporting multiple interfaces.

note" I can't say when I'll get a chance to look into this, sorry....

Read full topic

item.title: Nord Stage 2 midi not working
item.dc:creator: @gabriel
item.description:
@gabriel wrote:

Nord Stage 2 USB MIDI does not seem to work.


Axoloti says: USB Device Attached
Axoloti says: PID: 21h
Axoloti says: VID: FFCh
Axoloti says: Address (#1) assigned.
Axoloti says: Manufacturer : Clavia DMI AB
Axoloti says: Product : Nord Stage 2
Axoloti says: Serial Number : N/A
Axoloti says: Enumeration done.
Axoloti says: This device has only 1 configuration.
Axoloti says: Default configuration set.
Axoloti says: Device not supporting VEN class.

Read full topic

item.title: Nord Stage 2 midi not working
item.dc:creator: @gabriel
item.description:
@gabriel wrote:

Just did a git pull, recompiled and still the kbd does not work.
Also connecting the USB out of a Nord state 2 (set to extern section to USB MIDI channel 1) to the Axoloti USB port does not trigger the subtractive synth either.
MIDI port works OK.
Now the Axoloti console reports the Nord, but it says:

This device has only 1 configurations.
Default configuration set.
Device no supporting VEN class.

Any ideas?

Read full topic
